intro: Acrolasia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf acrolasia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Acrolasia humilis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
